revised_title: Exploring the Structure and Composition of Cotton Hair Cell-Walls
tldr: The authors conducted detailed observations and experiments on the cell-wall structure of cotton hairs. They discovered that the primary wall has a spiral structure with possible reversals, and the secondary wall has distinct growth rings. The authors also found that the cotton hair cell-wall is an elaborate structure with unique features, such as slow spirals and radial boundary surfaces, which may be related to the plant's growth and development.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
